original: Holmberg, John Erik, rektor, Göteborg, f. 5/7/Ö7 i Tåby, Östergötl. 1., av kyrkoh. John H. o. Maria Kinnan-der. G. 37 m. Karin Hagberg. Barn: Johan f. 42, Lena 44, Krister 46. — Stud:ex. i Falun 25, fil. mag. i Upps. 29, fil. lic. 32, fil. dr 34, provår v. norra latin i Sthlm 34-35, doc. v. Gbgs högsk. 35. Ämneslär. v. Solbacka lä-rov. 33-34, vik. lektor v. norra latin 34-35, ämneslär. v. Gbgs h. samsk. 35-36, ord. dito 36 o. rektor där sed. 41, adj. i iktin o. grek. v. Hvitfeldtska h. a. 1. i Gbg sed. 39. Stud:res. t. bl. a. Ifal. o. Tyskil: 30’, Grekl, Itai. o-. Frankr. 31-32!, Itak, Grekil. o. Turk. 34, Ungern o. Grekl. 35, Grekl. 36-39, Förenta Staterna 46-47, stip. v. Sv. inst. i Rom 30, assist, där 31-32, föret, ar-keol. utgrävn. av den ant. staden Asea, hed :boTgare i moderna Asea. Skr.: vet:skapl. o. pop :vet :skapl. arb.
translated: Holmberg, John Erik, principal, Gothenburg, born July 5th, 1907 in Tåby, Östergötland, the first child of the vicar John H. and Maria Kinnander. Married in 1937 to Karin Hagberg and has three children: Johan born in 1942, Lena in 1944, and Krister in 1946. He completed his bachelor's degree from Falun in 1925, master's degree from Uppsala in 1929, licentiate degree in 1932, and doctoral degree in 1934. He completed his probationary year at Norra Latin in Stockholm from 1934-1935 and became a lecturer at Gothenburg University in 1935. He was subject teacher at Solbacka High School from 1933-1934, temporary lecturer at Norra Latin from 1934-1935, subject teacher at Gothenburg High School from 1935-1936, and appointed as a regular teacher and principal there since 1941. He was also a deputy professor of Latin and Greek at Hvitfeldtska High School from 1940-1941. He studied abroad including Italy and Germany from 1930-1932, Greece, Italy, and France in 1931-1932, and Greece and Turkey in 1934. He also studied in Greece from 1936-1939 and in the United States from 1946-1947. He received a scholarship from the Swedish Institute in Rome in 1930 and worked there as an assistant from 1931-1932. He conducted archaeological excavations in the ancient city of Asea and lived in modern Asea. He has written scientific and popular scientific works.

structured.name: John Erik Holmberg

structured.description: John Erik Holmberg was a Swedish principal and expert in Greek and Latin.
